DPRK Ambassador to Guinea Appointed 
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Pong Hui was appointed as DPRK ambassador e.p. to Guinea according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Fighting Slogans Made Public in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fighting Slogans Made Public in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration of south Korea reportedly made public fighting slogans of the May 18-June 15 period for national cooperation against the U.S. on May 14.
 The slogans call for preventing a war in the Korean peninsula and achieving national reunification with national cooperation. 
 The slogans call for opposing the establishment of the U.S. missile defence system, a threat of war in the Korean peninsula, halting the relocation of the U.S. troops in south Korea and blocking the troop dispatch to Iraq, bullet shields of the war of aggression.    
 The slogans also call for driving the U.S. troops, the principal culprit of a nuclear war in the Korean peninsula, out of south Korea, and call upon all the Koreans in the south and the north and overseas to bring earlier independent reunification by implementing the June 15 joint declaration.

GIs Commit Violence against S. Korean Taxi Driver
articles.content:
GIs Commit Violence against S. Korean Taxi Driver
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- GIs committed violence against a south Korean taxi driver on May 15, according to south Korean MBC.
 That day Corporal Ramond belonging to U.S. Second Division and another tried to run away without paying a taxi driver surnamed Ha. When he demanded the payment, they beat him.

articles.title: Meeting for Peace against U.S. and War Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Meeting for Peace against U.S. and War Held in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of the Movement against the U.S. and War and for the Earlier Conclusion of a Non-Aggression Treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. reportedly sponsored the 24th Friday meeting to defend peace from the U.S. and war near the U.S. embassy in Seoul on May 14.
 The co-chairman of the Headquarters of the People's Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Troops and the permanent co-representative of the Solidarity for the Implementation of the South-North Joint Declaration in their speeches said that such tragic happenings as GIs' atrocities in Iraq are reported in this land due to the U.S. troops present in south Korea, stating they can no longer suffer due to the U.S. troops and it is the way out for the Korean nation to drive them out of this land.    
 A resolution read out at the meeting noted that they would foil the U.S. brigandish pressure for additional troop dispatch to Iraq through struggle and fight against the U.S. threatening the existence of the Korean nation through national cooperation against the U.S.

National Exports Exhibition
articles.content:
National Exports Exhibition
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of export commodities is going on in Pyongyang.
 On show at the Central Hall of Light Industrial Samples are fibers, daily necessities, footwear, electronic products, foodstuffs and many other goods presented by exports manufacturing units.    
 At the hall of samples diverse services will be provided, which will include foreign trade and commercial activities and export contracts will be made.

Greetings to Cameroonian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Cameroonian President
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Paul Biya, president of the Republic of Cameroon, on Monday on the occasion of the 32nd anniversary of the Republic.
 Sincerely wishing the president greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country, he expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms.
